result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard Shane Hetrick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Richard Shane Hetrick in court with attorney Chris A. Gramstrup.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.
DEF pleads No Contest to Count 1.
Court finds DEF freely, voluntarily and intelligently waives rights.
Court accepts plea, finds guilty on Count 1. Count 2 is dismissed and read-in.
ADA Marcoux argues sentence. Atty Gramstrup argues sentence.
Court withholds sentence, places DEF on 3 years probation, complete any counseling deemed appropriate by agent imposes, Def. must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $ 250 surcharge. No contact with Ashley Conover-can be lifted at discretion of probation if deemed appropriate and Ms Conover agrees;
30 days county jail w/Huber, with credit for 3 days time served 
Time may be served in another county providing there is no cost to Sawyer county.
